author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: ‘Eaters Upended in Final Minute vs. San Francisco
text:
‘Eaters Upended in Final Minute vs. San Francisco
UC Irvine women's soccer suffered a last-minute defeat to
San Francisco, falling 2-1 after leading for most of the match. The Anteaters scored first with Mia Colombini's goal just before halftime, but the Dons equalized in the second half and netted the winner with only 12 seconds left on the clock. Despite dominating possession and shots, UC Irvine couldn't maintain their advantage, ending the match heartbreakingly.
- UC Irvine had a 13-6 shot advantage and a 7-1 edge in corner kicks.
- Mia Colombini scored her first career goal in the 43rd minute.
Despite the loss, UC Irvine's performance featured multiple opportunities, with key players showcasing their potential, particularly in their offensive strategy and execution.State of Play
- UC Irvine led 1-0 until the 63rd minute before the Dons equalized.
- The Anteaters searched for a second goal as they held the upper hand in overall shots and corner kicks.
UC Irvine aims to bounce back as they prepare to host Arizona on Sunday, September 1, with hopes of converting opportunities into goals.Bottom Line
The Anteaters must learn from their narrow loss to effectively capitalize on their advantages in upcoming matches, ensuring they finish strong when opportunities arise.
